original: @195a / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @195a / /rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya pra t'i tya sa muta p'a ra da n'a ma ma h'a y'a na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya pra t'i tya sa muta p'a ra da n'a ma ma h'a y'a na s'u tra /
translated: Ārya-pratītyasamutpāda-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra Called Dependent Origination

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i nang na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i nang na /
translated: The Blessed One was among the gods of the Thirty-Three,

original: aar mo ni ga lta bu'i rdo leb la rta thul la sogs pa nyan thos chen po rnams dang / 'phags pa byams pa dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang; lag na rdo rje la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan rin po che dpag tu med pas brgyan pa rnams dang /
analyzed: aar mo ni ga lta bu'i rdo leb la rta thul la sogs pa nyan thos chen po rnams dang / 'phags pa byams pa dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang; lag na rdo rje la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan rin po che dpag tu med pas brgyan pa rnams dang /
translated: on a flat rock like a polished crystal, together with the great hearers such as Aśvajit, the noble Maitreya, the noble Avalokiteśvara, Vajrapāṇi, and other bodhisattva mahāsattvas adorned with immeasurable precious qualities,

original: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa chen po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa lha rnams dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / dri za'i rgyal po gtsug phud lnga pa dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa chen po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa lha rnams dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / dri za'i rgyal po gtsug phud lnga pa dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
translated: the lord of the Sahā world, the great Brahmā, and the gods such as Nārāyaṇa and Maheśvara, as well as the lord of the gods Śakra, and the kinnara king Pañcaśikha.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga ri rab @195b kyi rtse mo la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga ri rab @195b kyi rtse mo la btsugs te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, and placed his right knee on the peak of Mount Sumeru.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Bowing to the Blessed One with palms joined, he addressed the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: lha 'di dag ni mchod rten bgyid par 'tshal ba sha stag ste /
analyzed: lha 'di dag ni mchod rten bgyid par 'tshal ba sha stag ste /
translated: these gods all wish to make stūpas.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir mchis na /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir mchis na /
translated: Since they are present in this assembly,

original: ci nas tshangs pa'i bsod nams 'phel ba dang / lha dang bcas pa /
analyzed: ci nas tshangs pa'i bsod nams 'phel ba dang / lha dang bcas pa /
translated: how can the merit of Brahmā increase, and how can the gods and humans who make stūpas for the relics of the Tathāgata's body be of benefit?

original: bdud dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas pa /
translated: with the māras,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu las dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag bsod nams shin tu mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la chos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu las dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag bsod nams shin tu mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la chos bstan du gsol /
translated: and with the world of Brahmā, in the world with its celestial beings, Māras, and Brahmās, among the beings including renunciants and brahmins—the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers—may the Blessed One teach the Dharma in such a way that they may greatly increase their merit.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /🔽ye dharm'a he tu pra bha b'a he tunte sh'ana ta th'a ga to hya ba data /🔽te sh'anytsa yo ni ro dha ae bam b'a d'i ma h'a shra mana /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa / ye dharm'a he tu pra bha b'a he tunte sh'ana ta th'a ga to hya ba data / te sh'anytsa yo ni ro dha ae bam b'a d'i ma h'a shra mana /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse on dependent origination:

original: chos gang rgyu byung de dag gi /🔽rgyu dang de 'gog gang yin pa'ang //
analyzed: chos gang rgyu byung de dag gi / rgyu dang de 'gog gang yin pa'ang //
translated: “All phenomena arise from causes.🔽The Tathāgata has declared the causes,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te //
translated: And also their cessation.

original: dge sbyong chen pos de skad gsungs //
analyzed: dge sbyong chen pos de skad gsungs //
translated: This is the great sage’s teaching.”

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku yin te /
translated: This dependent origination is the Dharma body of the Tathāgatas.

original: sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination sees the Tathāgata.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu @196a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu @196a *//
translated: son of noble family,

original: mdo dad pa can gang la la zhig gis mi gnas pa'i phyogs su mchod rten ni skyu ru ra'i 'bru tsam /
analyzed: mdo dad pa can gang la la zhig gis mi gnas pa'i phyogs su mchod rten ni skyu ru ra'i 'bru tsam /
translated: If some faithful person were to make a stūpa in an uninhabited place, the size of a jujube fruit,

original: srog shing ni khab tsam /
analyzed: srog shing ni khab tsam /
translated: with a life-tree the size of a needle,

original: gdugs ni ba ku la'i me tog tsam zhig byas la /
analyzed: gdugs ni ba ku la'i me tog tsam zhig byas la /
translated: and a parasol the size of a bakula flower,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings kyi tshigs su bcad pa nang du bcug na de tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings kyi tshigs su bcad pa nang du bcug na de tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and insert the verse on dependent origination, the realm of phenomena, they would generate the merit of Brahmā.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos shing 'chi ba'i dus byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos shing 'chi ba'i dus byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having died and transmigrated from here, they would be reborn in the world of Brahmā.

original: de nas shi 'phos te 'chi ba'i dus byas nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos te 'chi ba'i dus byas nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after death, at the end of life, they will be reborn in the same world as the gods of the Pure Abodes.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas nyan thos de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas nyan thos de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken thus, those śrāvakas, those bodhisattvas, and the entire assembly

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: together with the world of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa mngon par bstod do //
translated: rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's words.

original: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Mahāyāna sūtra called The Origination of Dependent Origination is completed.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po su rendra bo dhi dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa ////
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po su rendra bo dhi dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa ////
translated: Translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptor Surendrabodhi and the chief editor and translator Bandé Yeshé Dé.
